column1: Athlete's foot is an infection of the feet caused by fungus or yeast.
Athlete's foot is the most common type of tinea infection.
Your health care provider can diagnose athlete's foot simply by looking at your skin.
Over-the-counter antifungal powders or creams can help control the infection: - These contain medicine such as miconazole, clotrimazole, terbinafine, or tolnaftate.
Your provider may prescribe: - Antifungal medicines to take by mouth - Antibiotics to treat bacterial infections that occur from scratching - Prescription topical creams that kill fungus and yeast
